$interpreted: Barbara: Miss Chevalier, I've finished looking over this report. Please put it back.
Tica: Yes, ma'am!
Cara: Uh...umm...Headmaster Balzac, do you have a minute?
Barbara: I'm always busy. Otherwise, I wouldn't be where I am. What is it?
Cara: We have some guests. They’ve come from the Desert Kingdom. They say it's urgent.
Barbara: ...If they could find the entrance, the headmaster may not refuse a meeting. That is our school's tradition, after all.
Barbara: Bring them in.
Sophie: Hello, my name is Sophie Lee. Thank you so much for meeting with us——
Sophie: ...Is Headmaster Charle Ceres available?
Tica: Eh? He left his post some time ago. You didn't know?
Sophie: Left his post? So Elio's adoptive father is no longer here!?
Barbara: I'm Barbara Balzac, the current headmaster of the Rune Academy.
Barbara: Miss Lee, are you here for matters concerning the Academy, or the previous headmaster?
Sophie: I...
Sophie: （Since headmaster Ceres isn’t here...I guess I’ll have to ask her for help…）
Sophie: It’s like this...
Sophie: ...So, Elio might be in grave danger.
Sophie: We really need your help. Come help us save Elio!
Barbara: I must refuse.
Sophie: Why!? He’s in serious danger──
Barbara: First, I don’t know if you’re telling me the truth, and it’s not our obligation to help verify your story.
Sophie: I wouldn’t use Elio’s safety to trick someone!
Barbara: I’m not finished. The important thing is that Elio Ceres is no longer a student of the Rune Academy.
Barbara: He has betrayed both the Academy and the Kingdom. What does his safety have to do with me?
Sophie: I won’t let you talk about Elio like that!
Barbara: In any case, I don’t trust you.
Barbara: I’m already terribly busy cleaning up this mess that Ceres left behind. Tica, see the guests out.
Tica: Headmaster, Tica is willing to give it a go! I’ll help them!
Barbara: No.
Tica: But what if she’s telling the truth? Are we just going to sit back and watch Elio die?
Tica: We’ve known him for such a long time...
Barbara: Sometimes you’ve got to worry about yourself! I’ve told you many times before that you ought to focus on your studies!
Barbara: I’m not going to be like Ceres and let you use errands for credits!
Tica: I-I know...
Barbara: You know what your attendance looks like. Now, escort the guests out.
Tica: I’m sorry. I can’t help...
Sophie: I didn’t think that Headmaster Ceres would have already left his position...
Tica: The Academy lost many students because of the Civil War.
Tica: Some professors, who were unhappy with the head...the previous headmaster, used Elio’s story to cause a fuss and criticize him for what happened.
Sophie: Did Headmaster Ceres not defend himself?
Tica: No. The Headmaster was never the best at defending himself. Plus...after Elio left, he didn’t have the heart to stay engaged in academic affairs.
Tica: He figured he might as well leave the Academy and search for Elio.
Sophie: Umm, do you have any idea where he went to look for Elio?
Tica: I’m sorry, I don’t know.
Tica: Don’t look so upset...oh, yea!
Tica: oh, yea!
Tica: I’ll ask around campus and see if I can find anything out. Who knows? Maybe something will come up.
Sophie: Okay. Thank you...

Model.Text: Miss Chevalier, I've finished looking over this report. Please put it back.

He figured he might as well leave the Academy and search for Elio.

Okay. Thank you...
